description: Spec-Kit prompts for specification-driven development workflows

prompts.title: Initialize Spec-Kit Project
prompts.description: Set up a new project with spec-driven development workflow including templates, scripts, and AI agent integration.
prompts.prompt:
Let's initialize a new spec-driven development project! üéØ

**Project Setup Process:**

1. **Check Current Environment**: I'll verify if we're already in a spec-kit project (look for `.specify` folder)
2. **Initialize New Project**: Set up project structure with `specify init <project-name>`
3. **Configure AI Integration**: Choose your preferred AI agent (claude, copilot, gemini, cursor, etc.)
4. **Explain Workflow**: Show you the available slash commands and methodology

**What's the name of your new project?**

*Example: `my-photo-app` or `user-auth-service`*

Once initialized, you'll have access to the complete spec-driven workflow:
‚Ä¢ `/constitution` - Define project principles
‚Ä¢ `/specify` - Create feature specifications
‚Ä¢ `/plan` - Generate technical plans
‚Ä¢ `/tasks` - Break down into actionable tasks
‚Ä¢ `/implement` - Execute implementation

Ready to get started?
prompts.author: GitHub Spec-Kit

prompts.title: Create Project Constitution
prompts.description: Define project principles and governance that will guide all development decisions and ensure consistency across features.
prompts.prompt:
Let's establish your project constitution - the foundational principles that will guide all development! üìú

**Constitution Creation Process:**

1. **Analyze Current Context**: I'll check if you already have a constitution and understand your project
2. **Define Core Principles**: Create non-negotiable rules for your development process
3. **Set Governance**: Establish how principles are updated and enforced
4. **Sync Dependencies**: Ensure all templates align with your new principles

**What principles should guide your project?**

*Examples:*
‚Ä¢ Code quality standards (testing requirements, review processes)
‚Ä¢ User experience consistency (accessibility-first, performance targets)
‚Ä¢ Technical constraints (preferred frameworks, deployment requirements)
‚Ä¢ Security requirements (authentication standards, data protection)

**Tell me about your project's core values and constraints:**

I'll create a comprehensive constitution that includes:
‚Ä¢ Principle definitions with clear rationale
‚Ä¢ Amendment procedures and versioning
‚Ä¢ Compliance review expectations
‚Ä¢ Template synchronization

This becomes the foundation for all future specifications and technical decisions!
prompts.author: GitHub Spec-Kit

prompts.title: Create Feature Specification
prompts.description: Generate a comprehensive feature specification from natural language description using spec-kit methodology and templates.
prompts.prompt:
Let's create a detailed feature specification using the spec-kit methodology! üìã

**Specification Process:**

1. **Create Feature Branch**: I'll run the create-new-feature script to set up a new branch and spec file
2. **Generate Comprehensive Spec**: Use the spec-kit template to create:
   ‚Ä¢ User scenarios and testing approaches
   ‚Ä¢ Functional requirements (testable and unambiguous)
   ‚Ä¢ Key entities and data models
   ‚Ä¢ Success criteria and acceptance criteria
3. **Mark Clarifications**: Highlight any areas that need more detail with [NEEDS CLARIFICATION] markers
4. **Review Checklist**: Validate completeness and business alignment

**What feature do you want to build?**

*Be as detailed as possible about WHAT and WHY, avoid HOW:*

*Examples:*
‚Ä¢ "User authentication system with login, logout, and password reset"
‚Ä¢ "Photo album management with drag-and-drop organization"
‚Ä¢ "Real-time chat with message history and user presence"
‚Ä¢ "Task management with projects, assignments, and Kanban boards"

**Feature Description:**

I'll focus on:
‚úÖ What users need and why
‚úÖ Business requirements and user scenarios
‚úÖ Testable functional requirements
‚ùå Technical implementation details (saved for planning phase)

Ready to create your specification?
prompts.author: GitHub Spec-Kit

prompts.title: Clarify Specification Requirements
prompts.description: Run structured clarification workflow to resolve ambiguous requirements and ensure specification completeness before planning.
prompts.prompt:
Let's clarify any ambiguous areas in your specification before moving to technical planning! üîç

**Clarification Workflow:**

1. **Analyze Current Spec**: I'll read your feature specification and identify areas marked with [NEEDS CLARIFICATION]
2. **Structured Questioning**: Ask targeted questions about:
   ‚Ä¢ User types and permissions
   ‚Ä¢ Data retention and deletion policies
   ‚Ä¢ Performance targets and scale requirements
   ‚Ä¢ Error handling behaviors
   ‚Ä¢ Integration requirements
3. **Document Answers**: Record all clarifications in the specification
4. **Validate Completeness**: Ensure all requirements are testable and unambiguous

**Current clarification areas in your spec:**

I'll systematically work through each unclear aspect:
‚Ä¢ Who are the users and what are their roles?
‚Ä¢ What are the data and storage requirements?
‚Ä¢ What are the performance and scale expectations?
‚Ä¢ How should errors and edge cases be handled?
‚Ä¢ What integrations or external dependencies exist?

**Ready to clarify your specification?**

*This step is crucial for reducing rework during planning and implementation phases.*

Once clarified, your specification will be ready for technical planning with `/plan`!
prompts.author: GitHub Spec-Kit

prompts.title: Generate Technical Implementation Plan
prompts.description: Create detailed technical plan from specification including architecture, tech stack, data models, and implementation strategy.
prompts.prompt:
Let's create a comprehensive technical implementation plan for your feature! üèóÔ∏è

**Planning Process:**

1. **Analyze Specification**: I'll read your feature spec and understand all requirements
2. **Check Constitution**: Ensure alignment with project principles and constraints
3. **Generate Implementation Plan**: Create detailed technical plan including:
   ‚Ä¢ Architecture and tech stack decisions
   ‚Ä¢ Data models based on key entities
   ‚Ä¢ API contracts and interfaces
   ‚Ä¢ Research for technical decisions
   ‚Ä¢ Quickstart validation scenarios
4. **Validate Against Gates**: Check simplicity, anti-abstraction, and constitutional compliance

**What's your preferred technology approach?**

*Specify your tech stack and architectural preferences:*

*Examples:*
‚Ä¢ "React with TypeScript, Node.js backend, PostgreSQL database"
‚Ä¢ "Vanilla HTML/CSS/JavaScript, SQLite for local storage"
‚Ä¢ "Python FastAPI, Redis for caching, Docker deployment"
‚Ä¢ "Vue.js frontend, .NET Core API, SQL Server database"

**Technical Context:**

I'll generate:
üìã **Implementation Plan** - Architecture and approach
üóÑÔ∏è **Data Model** - Entities and relationships
üîå **API Contracts** - Endpoints and specifications
üî¨ **Research Notes** - Technical decisions and rationale
‚ö° **Quickstart Guide** - Key validation scenarios

Ready to create your technical plan?
prompts.author: GitHub Spec-Kit

prompts.title: Generate Implementation Tasks
prompts.description: Break down technical plan into actionable, dependency-ordered tasks ready for execution with parallel execution markers.
prompts.prompt:
Let's break down your implementation plan into actionable tasks! ‚úÖ

**Task Generation Process:**

1. **Analyze Design Artifacts**: I'll read your plan.md, data-model.md, contracts/, and other design documents
2. **Generate Task Breakdown**: Create specific tasks organized by phases:
   ‚Ä¢ **Setup Tasks**: Project init, dependencies, configuration
   ‚Ä¢ **Test Tasks [P]**: Contract tests, integration scenarios (parallel)
   ‚Ä¢ **Core Tasks**: Models, services, CLI commands, endpoints
   ‚Ä¢ **Integration Tasks**: Database, middleware, logging
   ‚Ä¢ **Polish Tasks [P]**: Unit tests, performance, docs (parallel)
3. **Order Dependencies**: Ensure proper execution sequence (TDD approach)
4. **Mark Parallelization**: Identify tasks that can run simultaneously with [P]

**Task Generation Rules:**
‚Ä¢ Each contract ‚Üí test task marked [P]
‚Ä¢ Each entity ‚Üí model creation task marked [P]
‚Ä¢ Each endpoint ‚Üí implementation task
‚Ä¢ Different files = parallel [P]
‚Ä¢ Same files = sequential
‚Ä¢ Tests before implementation (TDD)

**Additional context for task generation:**

*Any specific requirements or preferences for the implementation approach?*

I'll create a `tasks.md` file with:
üìù **Numbered Tasks** (T001, T002, etc.)
üìÅ **File Paths** for each task
üîó **Dependencies** clearly marked
‚ö° **Parallel Groups** for efficient execution

Ready to generate your implementation tasks?
prompts.author: GitHub Spec-Kit

prompts.title: Execute Feature Implementation
prompts.description: Execute all implementation tasks following the task breakdown with TDD approach, dependency management, and progress tracking.
prompts.prompt:
Let's implement your feature following the spec-driven task breakdown! üöÄ

**Implementation Process:**

1. **Load Implementation Context**: I'll read all your design documents:
   ‚Ä¢ tasks.md (execution plan)
   ‚Ä¢ plan.md (architecture and tech stack)
   ‚Ä¢ data-model.md (entities and relationships)
   ‚Ä¢ contracts/ (API specifications)
   ‚Ä¢ research.md (technical decisions)

2. **Execute Phase-by-Phase**:
   ‚Ä¢ **Setup**: Project structure, dependencies, configuration
   ‚Ä¢ **Tests**: Contract tests and integration scenarios (TDD)
   ‚Ä¢ **Core**: Models, services, CLI commands, endpoints
   ‚Ä¢ **Integration**: Database, middleware, logging
   ‚Ä¢ **Polish**: Unit tests, performance, documentation

3. **Follow Execution Rules**:
   ‚Ä¢ Respect task dependencies (sequential vs parallel)
   ‚Ä¢ Tests before implementation (TDD approach)
   ‚Ä¢ File-based coordination (same file = sequential)
   ‚Ä¢ Mark completed tasks with [X]

4. **Progress Tracking**: Report after each completed task with validation

**Implementation preferences:**

*Any specific notes for the implementation (deployment targets, testing frameworks, etc.)?*

I'll execute tasks systematically:
‚úÖ **Validate Prerequisites** - All documents ready
üìã **Phase-by-Phase Execution** - Setup ‚Üí Tests ‚Üí Core ‚Üí Integration ‚Üí Polish
üîÑ **Real-time Progress** - Track completion and handle errors
üéØ **Final Validation** - Ensure specs match implementation

Ready to build your feature?
prompts.author: GitHub Spec-Kit

prompts.title: Analyze Spec-Kit Project Status
prompts.description: Comprehensive analysis of current spec-kit project state including features, phases, and recommended next steps.
prompts.prompt:
Let me analyze your spec-kit project and show you the current state! üìä

**Project Analysis Process:**

1. **Project Structure Review**: I'll examine your `.specify` directory and validate:
   ‚Ä¢ Templates and scripts availability
   ‚Ä¢ Project constitution and principles
   ‚Ä¢ Current branch and feature context

2. **Feature Inventory**: Scan the `specs/` directory to identify:
   ‚Ä¢ All features and their completion status
   ‚Ä¢ Current phase (specification, planning, tasks, implementation)
   ‚Ä¢ Missing or incomplete artifacts

3. **Health Check**: Verify project follows spec-kit best practices:
   ‚Ä¢ All required templates present
   ‚Ä¢ Script permissions and functionality
   ‚Ä¢ Git branch structure and workflow

4. **Progress Assessment**: For the current feature:
   ‚Ä¢ What phase are you in?
   ‚Ä¢ What files exist vs. what's missing?
   ‚Ä¢ What's the logical next step?

**Current Project Overview:**

I'll provide:
üìã **Feature Status Matrix** - All features and their phases
üéØ **Current Focus** - Active feature and next steps
‚öôÔ∏è **Configuration Health** - Templates and scripts status
üìà **Recommendations** - Suggested workflow continuations

**Any specific areas you'd like me to focus on?**

*Examples: "Focus on feature completion status" or "Check for any configuration issues"*

Let me give you a complete project status report!
prompts.author: GitHub Spec-Kit

prompts.title: Validate Spec-Kit Workflow Compliance
prompts.description: Check project adherence to spec-kit methodology and constitutional requirements with recommendations for improvements.
prompts.prompt:
Let's validate your project's compliance with spec-kit methodology and constitutional requirements! ‚úÖ

**Compliance Validation Process:**

1. **Constitutional Compliance**: I'll check if your features align with project constitution:
   ‚Ä¢ Principle adherence in specifications
   ‚Ä¢ Technical decisions follow governance
   ‚Ä¢ Implementation respects constraints

2. **Methodology Validation**: Verify proper spec-kit workflow:
   ‚Ä¢ Specifications focus on WHAT/WHY (not HOW)
   ‚Ä¢ Technical plans follow from specifications
   ‚Ä¢ Tasks properly break down implementation
   ‚Ä¢ Test-driven development approach

3. **Quality Assessment**: Review specification and planning quality:
   ‚Ä¢ Requirements are testable and unambiguous
   ‚Ä¢ No [NEEDS CLARIFICATION] markers remain
   ‚Ä¢ Success criteria are measurable
   ‚Ä¢ Technical decisions have clear rationale

4. **Process Adherence**: Check workflow execution:
   ‚Ä¢ Proper phase progression (spec ‚Üí plan ‚Üí tasks ‚Üí implement)
   ‚Ä¢ Branch management and version control
   ‚Ä¢ Documentation completeness

**Compliance Report:**

I'll generate:
üìã **Constitutional Alignment** - Principle compliance score
üîÑ **Workflow Adherence** - Methodology following assessment
üìù **Quality Metrics** - Specification and planning quality
‚ö†Ô∏è **Issue Identification** - Areas needing attention
üéØ **Recommendations** - Specific improvement actions

**Any specific compliance areas you're concerned about?**

Ready for a complete compliance assessment?
prompts.author: GitHub Spec-Kit
